meanings.definition: A nearly level land surface produced by the long-continued erosion of a region, commonly at the base of a mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The peneplains stretched out like a smooth blanket at the foot of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The hikers enjoyed the gentle slopes of the peneplains after their mountain climb.
meanings.sent3: The cows seemed to prefer grazing on the peneplains rather than the rugged mountainside.
meanings.sent4: The peneplains whispered tales of ancient rivers and weathering over time.
meanings.sent5: The peneplains were a peaceful haven amidst the towering peaks.

meanings.sent1: Over millions of years, the river slowly peneplained the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The constant flow of water worked to peneplain the rough terrain into a flat expanse.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that he would peneplain his backyard if he had a river handy.
meanings.sent4: Her patience and dedication peneplained the project into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's chisel peneplained the block of marble into a work of art.
